title: Create a Map with ElmerGeo Data
text: Leaflet popular open-source JavaScript library interactive maps. R package leaflet makes easy integrate control Leaflet maps R. Leaflet maps can made display spatial data one simple-feature (sf) layers.

title: Create a Map with ElmerGeo Data
text: SF stands “simple features”, standardized way encoding spatial data. R, spatial datasets typically stored sf objects.

what: So how do I make a map?
title: Create a Map with ElmerGeo Data
text: can make simple map essentially two steps (three count loading libraries). example create layer county polygons COUNTY_BACKGROUND feature layer ElmerGeo. Create layer create sf layer data ElmerGeo, using st_read_elmergeo() function: Display layer leaflet map. creates map simple styling. can learn enhance aesthetics leaflet documentation. using RStudio map automatically rendered viewer pane.

title: st_read_elmergeo
text: following creates sf object county_layer polygon layer COUNTY_BACKGROUND ElmerGeo:

title: Authors and Citation
text: Chris Peak. Author, maintainer. Michael Jensen. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Peak C, Jensen M (2022). psrcelmer: Provides streamlined methods retrieve data PSRC's databases Elmer ElmerGeo.. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://psrc.github.io/psrcelmer/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {psrcelmer: Provides streamlined methods to retrieve data from PSRC's databases Elmer and ElmerGeo.},   author = {Chris Peak and Michael Jensen},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://psrc.github.io/psrcelmer/}, }

what: Provides streamlined methods to retrieve data from PSRC's databases Elmer and ElmerGeo.
title: Provides streamlined methods to retrieve data from PSRC's databases Elmer and ElmerGeo.
text: R utilities interacting Elmer ElmerGeo package provides single-line tools retrieve data sets PSRC’s data warehouse databases Elmer ElmerGeo.

title: Provides streamlined methods to retrieve data from PSRC's databases Elmer and ElmerGeo.
text: Elmer database containing agency’s general-use tabular data. constantly expanding contents, currently ranges demographic, employment, aviation, parking, survey data.

title: Provides streamlined methods to retrieve data from PSRC's databases Elmer and ElmerGeo.
text: ElmerGeo PSRC’s home geospatial data use staff. past used shapefiles spatial data, today store layers within geodatabase. PSRC, database use purpose named ElmerGeo.

title: Provides streamlined methods to retrieve data from PSRC's databases Elmer and ElmerGeo.
text: can install package following command: load :

title: Provides streamlined methods to retrieve data from PSRC's databases Elmer and ElmerGeo.
text: use package first need login SQL Server Sockeye (AWS-PROD-SQL\Sockeye). See agency’s staff need login created, questions . Windows machine, now need order connect retrieve data Elmer ElmerGeo. Windows account can authenticate seamlessly, without requiring supply another username password. Mac, Linux TRS-80 machine need provide username password. , need set two environment variables computer. variables SOCKEYE_UID SOCKEYE_PWD. , SQL username “some_username” password “some_passwd”, set , R: set, able connect run functions package.

title: get_query(db_name, sql) — get_query
text: Retrieve dataset defined SQL string

title: get_query(db_name, sql) — get_query
text: db_name String.  name database run query .  "Elmer" "ElmerGeo".  Default = "Elmer". sql String.  SQL command send <db_name>.

title: get_query(db_name, sql) — get_query
text: data frame.

title: get_table(db_name, tbl_name) — get_table
text: Retrieve dataset defined table name.

title: get_table(db_name, tbl_name) — get_table
text: db_name String.  name database run query .  "Elmer" "ElmerGeo".  Default = "Elmer". schema String.  name schema table exists .  default. tbl_name String.  name table retrieved.  default.

title: get_table(db_name, tbl_name) — get_table
text: data frame.

title: get_table(db_name, tbl_name) — get_table
code: get_table(schema = 'chas', tbl_name = 'tenure_dim') #>   tenure_dim_id          created_at          updated_at #> 1             1 2021-01-08 14:47:29 2021-01-08 15:07:17 #> 2             2 2021-01-08 14:47:29 2021-01-08 15:07:17 #> 3             3 2021-01-08 14:47:29 2021-01-08 15:07:33 #>                     tenure_name tenure_order #> 1                Owner occupied            1 #> 2               Renter occupied            2 #> 3 Total: Occupied housing units            0

title: list_layers(feature_dataset) — list_layers
text: list layers available ElmerGeo

title: list_layers(feature_dataset) — list_layers
text: feature_dataset String.  supplied, filters list just layers feature dataset

title: list_layers(feature_dataset) — list_layers
text: dataframe listing layer names along corresponding feature datasets geometry types..  Defaults NULL.

title: st_read_elmergeo(layer_name, ...) — st_read_elmergeo
text: read simple features PSRC's -house geodatabase #' function preferable sf::st_read() pulling Elmer ElmerGeo, avoids incompatibilities SQL Server's data types R's.

title: st_read_elmergeo(layer_name, ...) — st_read_elmergeo
text: layer_name name feature layer geodatabase table schema_name name schema layer_name exists .  Defaults "dbo", standard schema ElmerGeo tables project_to_wgs84 (TRUE/FALSE) TRUE deliver output WGS84 projection, otherwise NAD84 / WA State Plane North.  Defaults TRUE.

title: st_read_elmergeo(layer_name, ...) — st_read_elmergeo
text: object class sf

title: st_read_elmergeo(layer_name, ...) — st_read_elmergeo
text: layer set ESRI versioned layer geodatabase, function returns versioned view (exists SQL Server "_evw" suffix).  set way, returns base table.
